Function: Forebrain: Governs complex cognitive functions such as thought, emotion, and voluntary movement.
Child: Telencephalon  (https://www.notion.so/Telencephalon-1164f5eb852480fba218cac3dd79e421?pvs=21), Diencephalon  (https://www.notion.so/Diencephalon-1164f5eb852480f6906df08474c2dbb3?pvs=21), Lateral Ventricle (https://www.notion.so/Lateral-Ventricle-1164f5eb8524807d954fc5c8ac7388a1?pvs=21), Third Ventricle (https://www.notion.so/Third-Ventricle-1164f5eb852480e2810ce74aaea0db48?pvs=21)

Function: Relays sensory and motor signals and manages basic visual and auditory reflexes.
Controls essential life-sustaining functions like breathing, heartbeat, and motor coordination.
Manages higher brain functions, including sensory perception, motor skills, and cognition.
Child: Cerebrum  (https://www.notion.so/Cerebrum-1164f5eb852480788afac920d7701cdc?pvs=21), Cerebral Cortex (https://www.notion.so/Cerebral-Cortex-1164f5eb852480c7a9bcf0ca74cad201?pvs=21), Basal Ganglia (https://www.notion.so/Basal-Ganglia-1164f5eb852480c48abeffec0e0083b0?pvs=21), Limbic System (https://www.notion.so/Limbic-System-1164f5eb852480aeb4ecfafcc5f07fe2?pvs=21), Corpus Callosum (https://www.notion.so/Corpus-Callosum-1164f5eb85248093a1acd14a634c0371?pvs=21)

Function: Acts as a relay station for sensory information and helps regulate autonomic functions and emotions.
Coordinates sensory input with motor responses and is crucial for vision and hearing reflexes.
Child: Tectum (https://www.notion.so/Tectum-1164f5eb85248092834bf119abf82821?pvs=21), Tegmentum (https://www.notion.so/Tegmentum-1164f5eb852480c7a739cb176e6d2e7b?pvs=21), Reticular Formation  (https://www.notion.so/Reticular-Formation-1164f5eb852480d88dd6f6118cfc0b3c?pvs=21), Periaquaductal gray matter (https://www.notion.so/Periaquaductal-gray-matter-1164f5eb852480678d14fde7555febe4?pvs=21), Red Nucleus (https://www.notion.so/Red-Nucleus-1164f5eb8524808f821cc9f77b3eb7fe?pvs=21), Substantia Niagra (https://www.notion.so/Substantia-Niagra-1164f5eb852480b6b4c5e8498b701e55?pvs=21)

Function: Involved in motor control and coordination, particularly through the cerebellum and pons.
Controls vital autonomic functions such as heart rate, breathing, and blood pressure through the medulla oblongata.
Responsible for integrating sensory information, reasoning, emotions, and voluntary motor activities.
Child: Cerebral Cortex (https://www.notion.so/Cerebral-Cortex-1164f5eb852480c7a9bcf0ca74cad201?pvs=21), Basal Ganglia (https://www.notion.so/Basal-Ganglia-1164f5eb852480c48abeffec0e0083b0?pvs=21), Limbic System (https://www.notion.so/Limbic-System-1164f5eb852480aeb4ecfafcc5f07fe2?pvs=21)

Function: The outermost layer of the cerebrum, responsible for higher-order brain functions, including perception, thought, and decision-making.
Child: Frontal Lobe (https://www.notion.so/Frontal-Lobe-1164f5eb8524801f8e47dd407e52bc3a?pvs=21), Parietal Lobe (https://www.notion.so/Parietal-Lobe-1164f5eb852480f3b078e6d5f0aada1b?pvs=21), Temporal Lobe (https://www.notion.so/Temporal-Lobe-1164f5eb8524806fae2fe0a091051a4a?pvs=21), Occipital Lobe (https://www.notion.so/Occipital-Lobe-1164f5eb8524807aade9e4c693b91a28?pvs=21)

Function: A group of nuclei that regulate voluntary motor movements, procedural learning, and habits.
A complex system responsible for emotion,  behavior, motivation, and memory.
Child: Limbic Cortex (https://www.notion.so/Limbic-Cortex-1164f5eb852480ae9c9dffc3056d0820?pvs=21), Cingulate Gyrus (https://www.notion.so/Cingulate-Gyrus-1164f5eb8524808f9a0fe27a6995006e?pvs=21), Hippocampus (https://www.notion.so/Hippocampus-1164f5eb852480e99135fa3a3742298f?pvs=21), Amygdala (https://www.notion.so/Amygdala-1164f5eb852480ed838fdacee2094208?pvs=21), Fornix (https://www.notion.so/Fornix-1164f5eb85248069af21caec1da0f70a?pvs=21), Mammillary Bodies (https://www.notion.so/Mammillary-Bodies-1164f5eb852480608369dfe7e0a75911?pvs=21)

Function: Acts as the brain’s relay center,  processing and transmitting sensory and motor signals to the cerebral cortex.
Maintains homeostasis by regulating bodily functions such as temperature, hunger, and thirst, and controlling the endocrine system.
A region in the brainstem involved in motor control, arousal, and some aspects of consciousness.

Child: Cerebellar Cortex (https://www.notion.so/Cerebellar-Cortex-1164f5eb85248076bd3ccc5099d90ed5?pvs=21), Inferior Cerebellar Peduncle (https://www.notion.so/Inferior-Cerebellar-Peduncle-1164f5eb85248002bc7fec1293c4bc1c?pvs=21), Superior Cerebellar Peduncle (https://www.notion.so/Superior-Cerebellar-Peduncle-1164f5eb852480a39676d3f74af79a9e?pvs=21), Middle Cerebellar Peduncle (https://www.notion.so/Middle-Cerebellar-Peduncle-1164f5eb852480229858d571b4f86093?pvs=21)

Function: Connects the upper and lower parts of the brain, and plays a role in sleep, respiration, and motor control.
Regulates autonomic functions such as heart rate, breathing, and blood pressure.
Responsible for complex cognitive functions such as decision-making, problem-solving, planning, and controlling voluntary  movements.

Processes sensory information like touch,
  temperature, and spatial awareness.

Involved in processing auditory information,
  memory, and language comprehension.

Primarily responsible for processing visual
  information.

The region that interprets visual stimuli
  from the eyes to construct an understanding of the visual environment.

Processes and interprets sound information
  from the ears, crucial for recognizing speech and music.

Receives and processes sensory input from
  the body, such as touch, pressure, and temperature.

Integrates and interprets sensory
  information to provide a comprehensive perception of the environment.

Controls and coordinates voluntary muscle
  movements throughout the body.

Plans and organizes voluntary movements
  before they are carried out by the motor cortex.

Child: Anterior Pituitary Gland (https://www.notion.so/Anterior-Pituitary-Gland-1164f5eb85248032b84cd078fef9f5b1?pvs=21), Posterior Pituitary Gland (https://www.notion.so/Posterior-Pituitary-Gland-1164f5eb85248082b074e0a211c9d6cf?pvs=21)

Function: Includes the Midbrain and Hindbrain

Child: Dura Mater (https://www.notion.so/Dura-Mater-1164f5eb852480e79ee9f975b49160bb?pvs=21), Arachnoid Membrane (https://www.notion.so/Arachnoid-Membrane-1164f5eb85248094b6f9fda916b6f6bc?pvs=21), Pia Mater (https://www.notion.so/Pia-Mater-1164f5eb852480548753c9b1fd47bbaa?pvs=21)
